reviews.text: Here, there’s something even more insidious at play that Villeneuve scratches at. It sees a future where a strand of religious fanaticism embodied within a single person can turn a culture inside out from within.
reviews.author: Murjani Rawls

reviews.text: Villeneuve amps up the operatic elements in this dense, beautiful, brash second chapter. The messy messianic message is filtered through modern eyes to its benefit, and in the end this game of thrones is as bloody and brilliant as hoped for
reviews.author: Jason Gorber

reviews.text: The film is a feverish dream of another world that feels as real and elusive as sand slipping through your fingertips... It's a place one would never want to be, and yet you do not want to leave.
reviews.author: David Crow

reviews.text: Part Two surpasses the first in almost every way. It is a technical masterpiece, as expected, but even the writing is a step up. It left me with this beautiful feeling that I had just experienced something truly special.
reviews.author: Austin Burke

reviews.text: What Villeneuve and company achieve in Dune: Part Two is every bit as impressive and, in its peak imagery, hypnotic as part one.
reviews.author: Michael Phillips

reviews.text: Dune: Part Two is an awe-inspiring, visually stunning sci-fi spectacle and a devastating collision of myth and destiny on a galactic scale
reviews.author: Graeme Guttmann

reviews.text: In an era when old sci-fi war horses Star Trek and Star Wars have stalled their big screen outings, and, at a time when sequels and reboots galore die at the box office, thank God for Dune Part Two.
reviews.author: David Reddish

reviews.text: Visually, at least, Dune: Part Two is a masterpiece... the film is regularly wondrous while also presenting a very gritty and lived-in world.
reviews.author: Mark Meszoros

reviews.text: The movie fairly throbs with conflicts and intrigues, all the more so if you see it on an IMAX screen with the deep bass of Hans Zimmer’s majestic score rumbling through your body.
reviews.author: Peter Howell

reviews.text: It may take five and a half hours for his character to truly come to life, but two films in, Chalamet’s evolution as Paul gives everything a center.
reviews.author: Danny Leigh

reviews.text: It shouldn’t work, honestly. There’s too much going on in too many directions at the same time. But Villeneuve brings it all together somehow.
reviews.author: Bill Goodykoontz

reviews.text: A true epic, this film is visually stunning, intense and suspenseful, and boasts a phenomenal cast who all bring their A-game. Timothée Chalamet is on another level.
reviews.author: Tessa Smith

reviews.text: Dune: Part Two is a screen-quaking cinematic landmark that should hold the future of blockbuster filmmaking accountable.
reviews.author: Cameron Frew

reviews.text: Dune: Part Two ups the ante in every way compared to the first film, and both movies combined form an incredible story of power and tribulation.
reviews.author: Michelle Kisner

reviews.text: The last act doesn't quite land, but the opening two hours make for some of Villeneuve's finest work.
reviews.author: David Jenkins

reviews.text: In terms of pure spectacle and shock-and-awe achievement, Villeneuve has produced an adaptation of mad glory and power.
reviews.author: Barry Hertz

reviews.text: One of the best blockbusters of the century so far, and an instant sci-fi classic.
reviews.author: Austen Goslin

reviews.text: …In an era where heroism and saviors are taken at face value, Dune: Part Two redefines what kind of stories blockbusters can tell.
reviews.author: James Preston Poole

reviews.text: A deeper and richer sequel aimed at grown-up sci-fi fans.
reviews.author: Rafer Guzman

reviews.text: The technology here is magic: something to be felt in your soul, not puzzled out in your head.
reviews.author: Robbie Collin

reviews.text: Our blockbuster drought is over, thanks to a brilliant sequel set on a sweltering desert planet.
reviews.author: Johnny Oleksinski

reviews.text: Part Two rights the cosmic battleship with plenty of staggering visuals, all the gigantic sandworms you’d ever want, plus a deeper thematic exploration of power, colonialism and religion.
reviews.author: Brian Truitt

reviews.text: Featuring absolutely staggering visuals, Dune: Part Two is an arresting, transportive middle entry in Denis Villeneuve’s tricky sci-fi saga.
reviews.author: Tom Jorgensen

reviews.text: The art of cinematic spectacle is alive and rocking in “Dune: Part Two,” and it’s a blast.
reviews.author: Manohla Dargis

reviews.text: Dune: Part Two has a few issues, most of which can be linked back to the decision to make this a true Part One and Part Two experience, but they aren't pervasive enough to ruin an overall excellent film.
reviews.author: Kaitlyn Booth

reviews.text: An instant landmark of its genre.
reviews.author: Joshua Rothkopf

reviews.text: The first film tackled the hard work of arranging the game pieces on the board, so Part Two swiftly sets about bashing them into one another. All those factional conflicts roiling away throughout the first film finally get to boil over at last.
reviews.author: Glen Weldon

reviews.text: After somewhat laboriously placing those chess pieces on the board in the first Dune, Villenueve and co-screenwriter Jon Spaihts send them into strategic alliances and conflicts, and the results are often breathtaking.
reviews.author: Alonso Duralde

reviews.text: This is a real epic and it is exhilarating to find a film-maker thinking as big as this.
reviews.author: Peter Bradshaw

reviews.text: Dune: Part 2 is an epic experience on the big screen.
reviews.author: Danielle Solzman

reviews.text: A masterful sequel that improves on the already excellent original.
reviews.author: Chris Bumbray

reviews.text: Extraordinary filmmaking. While the first film was impressive, this sequel is one of the greatest sci-fi / war films of all time. Visually stunning but this time also strong character development & commentary. Also lots of inventive action. A must see.
reviews.author: Grace Randolph

reviews.text: You might expect a big-budget space opera to exhilarate you and move you, and on those terms Villeneuve's sprawling, pretentious folly has to count as an abject failure. But if you want to feel awestruck, that's another matter.
reviews.author: Nicholas Barber

reviews.text: Blockbuster filmmaking at its finest... There’s so much accomplished here that stems from the confidence of the filmmakers involved and their trust in the audience’s willingness to dive even deeper into the world of Arrakis.
reviews.author: Aaron Neuwirth

reviews.text: Part Two possesses state-of-the-art cinematic qualities that reward soaking in its grandeur... After the initial promise, though, the film only sporadically rises to the level of its sky-high expectations.
reviews.author: Brian Lowry

reviews.text: Villeneuve has outdone himself. More importantly, he’s done justice to the scope and scale and sheer weirdness of a stoner-lit touchstone’s back half without, pun intended, sanding away its edges.
reviews.author: David Fear

reviews.text: It takes a good stretch of precious screentime for Part Two to play as anything other than a thoroughgoing, checklist-meeting obligation bolstered by obvious craft.
reviews.author: Nick Newman

reviews.text: Director Denis Villeneuve’s adaptation of Frank Herbert’s sprawling sci-fi classic is true to its source material in terms of scope (it’s huge!) and complexity (its plotting is very dense).
reviews.author: Soren Andersen

reviews.text: Things get spicier in Dune: Part Two with a messier entry. Embracing the weirdness of the source material has done wonders for the tone.
reviews.author: EJ Moreno

reviews.text: ...a sumptuous world of political machinations, messianic legend, and the nefarious grit of war-making. DUNE: Part Two is not only gorgeous filmmaking and storycraft, but its boots are on the necks of who humanity is now.
reviews.author: Sherin Nicole

reviews.text: Another epic helping of sci-fi wildness from Denis Villeneuve that’ll take true believers to paradise — even if it’s a bit too much Spice to digest in one sitting.
reviews.author: Ben Travis

reviews.text: If you like the aesthetic of Dune so far, and you like cinematic spectacle, the movie should scratch that itch on a basic level. But when it comes to fully delivering on the promise of the first, well, once again we are left hanging.
reviews.author: Luke Y. Thompson

reviews.text: Dune: Part Two belongs in the ranks of film's best sequels and sci-fi offerings.
reviews.author: Belen Edwards

reviews.text: Immersive, impressive, and wildly exhilarating, it’s an adrenaline rush to the head and heart, soaring in its breathtaking action sequences as much as it sings in its refined, evocative stillness.
reviews.author: Courtney Howard

reviews.text: This is sharper, slicker, more resonant than the first installment.
reviews.author: Nick Howells

reviews.text: Drops viewers right back into the world of Dune. It is a seamless follow-up to 2021's first part, with some new additions to the tale.
reviews.author: Fred Topel

reviews.text: There are moments in Dune: Part Two that feel so audacious, they play out as if they were already etched onto the cinematic canon.
reviews.author: Clarisse Loughrey

reviews.text: "Dune: Part Two" is a rare big, expensive blockbuster with a lot on its mind.
reviews.author: Chris Evangelista

reviews.text: Denis Villeneuve [delivers] another cinematic tour de force in Dune: Part Two; a hugely ambitious, contemplative sci-fi epic... which may also be the bleakest blockbuster ever made.
reviews.author: Mark Cassidy

reviews.text: A sci-fi epic for the ages: a sweeping tragedy of mythic proportions, a cautionary tale of the perils of zealotry. It’s a towering feat of sci-fi cinema that will put Dune: Part Two in contention for the pantheon of greatest sequels ever.
reviews.author: Hoai-Tran Bui

reviews.text: Could Herbert’s trippy Dune Messiah be adapted next, as teased? Tall order, that. But on the strength of this extravagantly, rigorously realized vision, make no mistake: Villeneuve is the man to see a way through that delirious desert storm.
reviews.author: Kevin Harley

reviews.text: Plagued by a nagging shallowness when it comes to portraying the Fremen... the film has difficulty fully embracing the nuance of Herbert’s anti-imperial and ecologically dystopian text.
reviews.author: Lovia Gyarkye

reviews.text: Whatever you do, don’t mistake this follow-up for a sequel. It’s the second half of a saga...
reviews.author: Peter Debruge

reviews.text: Villeneuve’s bold, brash presentation can sometimes feel bereft of personality, but it’s not short on vision, which it has in spades.
reviews.author: Clint Worthington

reviews.text: A masterpiece of breath-taking landscapes, incredible special effects and awe-inspiring action. Dune: Part Two is a complex and gorgeously layered production that could well be Villeneuve's best work to date.
reviews.author: Linda Marric

reviews.text: Part Two would be an epic achievement from any other director, but it feels that there is something bigger, better and obviously more decisive to come in the third and hopefully final part of the trilogy.
reviews.author: Damon Wise

reviews.text: Glorious! A cinematic masterpiece in all of its splendor. Villeneuve has outdone himself. Even better than Part One. The production and filmmaking are god tier. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Fico Cangiano

reviews.text: Dune: Part Two is more than a mere sequel. It’s a continuation, culmination, and ultimately a fantastic elevation of everything you already loved about director Denis Villeneuve’s 2021 film Dune: Part One.
reviews.author: Germain Lussier

reviews.text: Dune: Part Two is as huge an improvement upon its predecessor as The Dark Knight was to Batman Begins.
reviews.author: Reuben Baron

reviews.text: Not only does this new movie pick up exactly where the last one left off, it also carries over the strengths and weaknesses that made the previous chapter so astonishing to look at but stultifying to watch.
reviews.author: David Ehrlich

reviews.text: The story may never break free of its more dated tropes, but the Dune movies represent a remarkable collection of talent coming together to, if nothing else, remind us of the power of epic storytelling on a big screen.
reviews.author: Liz Shannon Miller

reviews.text: “Dune: Part Two” is a robust piece of filmmaking, a reminder that this kind of broad-scale blockbuster can be done with artistry and flair.
reviews.author: Brian Tallerico

reviews.text: I could watch Timothée Chalamet and Zendaya stare into each other’s deep blue eyes all day.
reviews.author: Joey Morona

reviews.text: 2024's first Best Picture contender
reviews.author: Kyle Pinion

reviews.text: Part Two picks up where the first instalment left off, literally and figuratively, delivering another stunning set of gorgeous visuals and exceptional action sequences.
reviews.author: Tim Grierson

reviews.text: Dune Part 2 left me speechless. A powerhouse epic masterpiece that becomes the TWO TOWERS of this decade. A special type of movie that only comes around every so often & will make you believe in what the magic of filmmaking can create.
reviews.author: Zach Pope

reviews.text: DUNE: PART TWO is nothing short of MONUMENTAL and one of the BEST sequels of all time. Denis Villeneuve accomplishes the impossible in crafting a massive and intricate film you need to see to believe.
reviews.author: Daniel Baptista

reviews.text: Dune: Part Two is a visually-monumental blockbuster that excels in cinematic spectacle.
reviews.author: Jeff Nelson

reviews.text: [Boasting] an ambitious and exhilarating story that matches its style, it’s the finest thing Villeneuve has helmed and the 2024 film to beat for outsized sci-fi showmanship.
reviews.author: Nick Schager

reviews.text: Stands in stark contrast to so many other shallow blockbusters of recent years.
reviews.author: Matt Singer

reviews.text: Movies are always enjoyed best on the biggest screen, but never has a movie demanded an IMAX screen more than Dune: Part Two. Get yourself to the biggest screen you can to enjoy this.
reviews.author: Therese Lacson

reviews.text: Dune: Part Two is as visually stunning and epic as the first movie, wrapping up this near-perfect two-part adaptation of Frank Herbert's book with an even more impressive cast in an action-packed epic.
reviews.author: Mireia Mullor

reviews.text: Dune: Part Two delivers on the promise of the prior installment and showcases epic science fiction on the grandest of scales.
reviews.author: Joey Magidson

reviews.text: Dune: Part Two builds upon what the first film established, expanding and improving this deeply rich and complex universe in nearly every aspect.
reviews.author: Matt Rodriguez

reviews.text: Dune: Part 2 is the year's first great film, and you won't see a bigger or better blockbuster all year... a sophisticated sci-fi masterpiece, an instant classic, and an unprecedented sequel.
reviews.author: M.N. Miller

reviews.text: A stirring piece of grown-up sci-fi delivering more spectacle than you’d see in several ordinary blockbusters stitched together. If it only wins our minds, not our hearts, it’s still one hell of a battle.
reviews.author: Matt Glasby

reviews.text: Reminiscent of the way Zack Snyder always goes maximum-effort operatic, but with a sense of discerning taste, Denis Villeneuve’s film is ultimately awe-inspiring and an immersive cinematic spectacle that is often breathtaking.
reviews.author: Rodrigo Perez

reviews.text: Denis Villeneuve’s film, like its predecessor, offers an object lesson in the visual splendor made possible by meticulously storyboarded minimalist maximalism.
reviews.author: Jake Cole

reviews.text: An incredibly innovative film, with jaw-dropping visuals, powerful performances, an impeccable score, and complex themes, Dune Part II is the closest a blockbuster has been to perfection since The Lord of the Rings.
reviews.author: Sheraz Farooqi

reviews.text: A spicy sequel that is ultimately a full sensory experience, one of the rare film sequels that is better than the predecessor.
reviews.author: Christie Cronan

reviews.text: Villeneuve has fully realized his dream of adapting Frank Herbert's beloved novel with the profoundness, respect, and scale it deserves in a tour de force of filmmaking we rarely see anymore. This is why we go to the movies.
reviews.author: Matt Neglia

reviews.text: A bonafide masterpiece that delivers on the promise of the first movie, while adding so much more in terms of layers and depth.
reviews.author: Edward Douglas

reviews.text: Dune: Part Two is Denis Villeneuve’s Empire Strikes Back & Lawrence of Arabia. It is a sci-fi opera that is grand in scale with a hypnotizing and emotionally devastating story. Villeneuve’s immersive cinematic nirvana is a sci-fi masterpiece.
reviews.author: David Gonzalez

reviews.text: Dune: Part Two leaves a promising franchise with more questions than answers as to whether this is the type of blockbuster we want made going forward: rocky attention to detail with the feeling of being rushed matched with an exhausted runtime.
reviews.author: Ryan McQuade

reviews.text: “Dune: Part 2” is the perfect filmmaking tapestry where every fiber is meticulously woven to create the perfect film. It’s an epic masterful cinematic experience.
reviews.author: Rosa Parra

synopsis: "Dune: Part Two" will explore the mythic journey of Paul Atreides as he unites with Chani and the Fremen while on a warpath of revenge against the conspirators who destroyed his family. Facing a choice between the love of his life and the fate of the known universe, he endeavors to prevent a terrible future only he can foresee.
